newsitem.title: TAIWAN: Acer, Texas Instruments in patents deal.
newsitem.headline: Acer, Texas Instruments in patents deal.

text.p: Taiwan computer giant Acer Inc. said Tuesday it agreed to a patents cross-licence with Dallas-based Texas Instruments.
The licence would cover Acer's personal computers, peripherals and display devices, Acer said in a statement.
"This cross-licence serves the interests of both parties in further developing new technology in the PC area," Acer's general controller George Huang said in the statement.
Acer and Texas Instruments had formed a semiconductor joint venture, TI-Acer Inc., in Taiwan's Hsinchu Science-Based Industrial Park to manufacture dynamic random access memory.
Acer already has patents cross-licences with International Business Machines Corp. and Intel Corp., it said.
